attributes.action: Tony Foulds  should receive an  honour for his work in remembering US airmen.
attributes.background: Tony Foulds was playing in a field with some friends when a damaged US bomber avoided a crash landing in the field, it crashed into nearby woods killing all 10 crewmen. For more than 60 years Tony has looked after their memorial every day, and speaks of them as his friends.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
